conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graph and understand the implications of symmetry about the dashed line.
The graph is symmetric about the dashed line.
The particle's velocity is zero at two specific times, t1 and t2.
The particle either remains stationary at these times or moves in a straight line parallel to the t-axis.
The particle must have passed through the positions corresponding to t1, t2, and another position.
The particle must have moved from one position to another, passing through the point where it was stationary at t1 and t2.
The particle could have moved in a straight line from t1 to t2, or it could have moved in a straight line from t2 to t1.
